description:
New local favorite.    With so many places nearby on Geary, it is hard to know where to choose.   Now we know!  
Stopped by for dinner on a Sunday and ordered the Chef's special and pumpkin curry. The pumpkin curry was really good, with the pumpkin well cooked and the curry spicy and delicious, but the Chef's special was amazing.   I wish I took note of what it was called because I just want that all the time now. 
2nd order was delivery, which arrived well within the estimated window.  Again, the food was delicious with good sized portions for the cost.
author: Maria C.

description:
Gonna first admit that I've not been a big fan of Thai food, because I don't really like my curries milky and sweet, and I don't like my non-breakfast foods with peanut sauce. However, I've enjoyed Thai food when done really well, and I was really hoping this highly rated restaurant would change my opinion about Thai food.

In fact, it kinda did the opposite. I found the pumpkin curry to be just weird; reinforcing my view that a sweet sauce with hints of curry is not the way to go. Their Pad Thai was alright, but not the best I've had or anything.
author: Albert Z.

description:
If you like Thai food, just go to this place, no questions asked. 

This place is amazing.. okay, let's start with ambience which is okkie tokkie, not as good as the food hahahaha , what ones that say about the food, just imagine. So the place is pretty simple ambience wise, but the food is to die for, specially if you eat non-veg. 

If you are okay to eat what I say, try their duck curry, that's hats off the best thing on their menu. We were eight people and everyone eordered something different , till duck curry was just too good to be not ordered again. Im going back to this place just so that I can have that. 

If you like Tom yum soup flavour then order Tom yum shrimp fried rice, it's soooo good. Their prawns and chicken were on the milder side and could have been more tasteful.

But overall this place serves good food, the staff is courteous and it's a good place for groups.
author: Ramyata M.

description:
I parked in front of Derm expecting to go to another restaurant down the street.  The wait was too long so as we walked back to the car, we decided to try Derm since there were plenty of tables available.  Good thing we went in when we did because about 4 more parties came in right behind us and filled up the place.  

I'm not usually on this side of town, but my husband suggested driving down this way.  Translate - could we please go somewhere new?  I mean, we go to new places all the time, but I guess he meant we stay in the same parts of the city when dining and we really should venture out a bit more.  

There were a lot of good things on the menu and I was worried I would order it all. I was good though and just ordered a couple of appetizers and entrees.  We started with the roti kang kiew and thoong thong, which I'll admit I was a little embarrassed to pronounce.  I saw the pork special and decided to order that along with the ga prow gai.  The pork was so tender and flavorful.  I liked the ga prow gai, but wish it didn't have so many onions.  The roti and thoong were delicious as well.  

A table near us mentioned they had a lot of dietary restrictions and it seemed like they were able to accomodate them pretty easily.  Service seemed to be a one person show and she nailed it, making sure we got water refilled and plates changed out between appetizers and main dishes.  It took a bit of time for dishes to come out, but I figured it was because they got slammed quickly, as well as several people came by for takeout orders.

I keep this place bookmarked for when I'm looking for Thai in this part of the city.  Definitely a good option for a small or big group.
author: Maria S.

description:
My boyfriend and I came late for dinner on a weekday so there was only one other party in the restaurant. We were in the area and this restaurant was recommended on Yelp. The restaurant is very clean and nicely decorated. The waitress was very responsive and friendly. 

Street parking only, which can be hard on Geary so beware! 

I ordered the Pad See Ew, my favorite (which I always get my first time at new Thai restaurants) and my boyfriend got the Pad Thai. 

Both dishes were very tasty. The sweetness really stood out to me compared to other Thai restaurants. I thought it was a perfect blend of sweet and salty. The portions were good for the price. It is a little expensive ($13 each) but I understand that we are eating in the Richmond District in SF so everything is expensive. 

I had a great experience so if you're in the area, this is a solid Thai restaurant!
author: Kelly N.

description:
I ordered the lunch special here with Pad Thai (with chicken), red curry with green beans and eggplant. And fried egg rolls. The sauce for the egg rolls were too sweet. The red curry was pretty good but wanted more vegetables (I would recommend maybe trying another curry) and Pad Thai was standard (the shrimp version may better, to which I am allergic). The lunch portion was huge - enough to feed two people. 

Not sure why the reviews were so high - just another standard Thai place to me.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
I've been here twice, and I gotta say go for the noodles! The pad kee mao was spicy but delicious, and the noodles soaked up the flavor without being overly greasy. Last time, I had their veggie spring roll which was ok definitely on the bland side.

Their portion sizes are good, however, for the price I'd expect more veggies+protein to pair with the noodles. It could have been a one-off experience, since we did come near closing time. Luckily the staff were super nice. They let us order and didn't kick us out even when we were done and stuck around chatting through 9 PM.
author: Rachel L.

description:
The friendly, nice server explained that Derm means original or traditional in Thai. Derm is quite original, with its varied menu and great cooking.

The interior is black with stylish lighting; dining there would make a great date night.

I thought before I entered that there weren't many vegetarian options. The helpful server explained which curry was vegetarian, and that most of the stir fried dishes could be made with tofu instead of meat. 

I chose the flavorful cucumber salad as an appetizer. Prik Khing Gai  (vegetables and tofu with house made ginger-chili paste) is excellent. Jasmine rice is included with many entrees. The desserts look good, but I didn't order one.

Derm is a Thai restaurant with creative cooking and a lovely interior. Try it when you're in the neighborhood!
author: Carol W.

description: I paid $30 (dinner for 1). A small cup of soup and pad Thai. I have spent all night and part of today in the bathroom. To say I will not be ordering from them again is an understatement. I might not even be able to order Thai for awhile after this. Now we interrupt this review for yet another trip to the restroom.
author: Monica F.

description:
I ordered in from Derm. It's a pretty decent spot to satisfy your Thai cravings. 

Pad Thai was pretty good but I thought the shrimp was a bit fishy which I usually do pretty well with normally. It was a little bit of a loose consistency which I didn't enjoy too much. 

I ordered cucumber salad which was very refreshing and well balanced in flavors. Good side to order. 

I would try again, maybe dine in or try some of their other interesting dishes.
author: Sarah K.

description: The food here is fresh and has lots of flavor. I love the spring rolls and the chicken with cashew. I also had the cucumber salad. A bit expensive but worth it.
author: J T.

description:
We happened to pass by this restaurant when the place we were originally going to was too full and decided to stop in here since there wasn't a wait. There actually weren't many people here for dinner, but we had a great experience.

Service was friendly and quick. The portions are quite large - my friend and I split veggie spring rolls, pad thai with tofu, and panang curry with tofu, and had enough left over for a late night second dinner. Everything was great, but the pad thai did have a slightly fishy taste to it. The panang curry was delicious, with just the right amount of spice and flavor.

The tofu was my favorite part. Ordering vegetarian meals at Thai restaurants is usually easy, but a lot of places don't put much effort into flavoring their tofu the way they flavor their meat, but Derm really does it right. The fried tofu in the pad thai and the firm tofu in the curry both had a great tangy lemon flavor that went really well with each dish.
author: Apoorva A.

description:
Before I write a five star review, I try to eat at the restaurant at least twice just so I know the first time wasn't a fluke. And Derm has passed the test! Dare I say it might be my favorite Thai restaurant in the Bay Area?! I've only tried their lunch offerings and hope to go back for dinner soon. 

Whenever I first try out a Thai restaurant, I always get the pad se ew just because it's my favorite. The pad see ew at Derm did not disappoint. Noodles were cooked perfectly. The sauce was not too sweet or too salty. Fresh and large cuts of veggies. And the PORK! The pork was so tender and seasoned so well. Normally, restaurants give you an option for which meat, but the only option they provide is the pork probably because they are that confident about it! Portions are also huge. You can definitely share this dish. 

The Roti with green curry was also fire! Served in a cone with two sauce cups on the side. Points for presentation! A little on the greasy side but the roti is served piping hot and crisp. The green curry has a kick but nothing you can't handle (even me as a non spicy food eater kept dipping because it was such a great pairing). 

The show stopper for me was the papaya salad though. Wow. I haven't had good papaya salad since my days traveling in Southeast Asia. The papaya salad is SO much better than the papaya salad at popular places like Burma superstar or Champa Garden. I don't know how to explain it. It just was the perfect level of tartness and sweetness and vinegar/fish sauceness. Please try the papaya salad and let me know what you think. 

They were also so gracious about menu adjustments. We wanted to get the Pumpkin red curry with tiger prawns and Thai basil but swap it out for the less spicy yellow curry. They were able to do that for us which was so nice. Warning about spice level - their mild is still pretty spicy! 

On my second visit, I tried the Pad Thai. Huge portions again. I love how they have big chunks of eggs and the pieces are not too sodden in the sauce like most places. I'm so appreciative of how fresh their ingredients are. I loved the large cuts of green onion and the extra portion of sprouts on the side to give the dish more crunch. Shrimps (5) are also big ones and thoughtfully deveined. 

We also got the Mu Yang, the marinated BBQ pork. Smokey and so delicious. Jeaw sauce comes with some cilantro in it so if you don't like cilantro you can just pick it out. Also comes with a small side salad pairing of cucumbers, pineapple, and red onions. 

Bottom line: I highly recommend it. Perhaps I like them so much because it suits my palette (I don't like overly salty or sweet food) and perhaps because each of the dishes transported me back to my favorite spots in Southeast Asia. Just something so right about this place. Hope they keep it up!
author: Lisa K.

description:
We had a nice dinner here on a Friday evening.  Tasty dishes, good service, and a pleasant atmosphere made for a good experience.

My husband and I shared the following (it was enough food for a party of four):

1) Minced chicken stir fry (Ga Prow Gai) - tasty
2) Off the bone pork ribs with peppercorn (Mu Prik Kang) - very flavorful 
3) Brussels sprouts (Ka Neang Num Pla) - good
4) Crab fried rice (Khao Pad Poo) - flavorful 

The service was friendly and efficient.

The setting is simple and clean.  The artwork on the walls was nice.  The place smelled a bit like cleaning chemicals when we arrived, which was a bit off putting.

Overall, we had a good meal here!
author: Barnali D.

description: I would say this is the best new Thai place. Theirs foods are really authentic and classic with original Thai flavor. Definitely recommend to anyone who like Thai's food or want to try how the original Thai food taste like. Just give them a try and you will plan to come back again very soon. Now this is my new go-to Thai place.
author: Dom G.

description:
Amazing food for a great price!

We had the roti appetizer: piping hot and had these great crunchy chilies in the sauce. 

Pad Thai: was perfection. Great shrimp!

Sticky rice + Cashew Chicken: omg I haven't had a chicken dish this good in a while! Plus the grilled pineapple was an added bonus. 

Seriously some of the best Thai we've had in a while!
author: Paulina L.

description:
Pad see ew...that's all I have to say. It's the best. The flavors and the consistency, magnifique!

Papaya salad is good and can really vary in spiciness based on how you order which is good,because if you're in the mood for spicy, you should be able to have it or not haha. 

Roti with curry sauce was bomb.com. It's a bit thicker than say Banana Island which is different, but good. 

We've also had the spare ribs, these were ok, nothing to write home about. 

The duck curry is good also and they don't skimp on portions either.

Overall, we like this place and we keep coming back. Service is also impeccable.
author: Guisela L.

description:
It is thai food and it is authentic but there is something missing so I gave it a 4 star, perhaps the chef's special took a while to get to our table (after we finished the meal), I was ready for them to say we didn't place the order and by the time they brought it we tasted it and took the rest home.
The setting is nice and friendly and the picture frames are nice, like the King Rama 5 cable stayed bridge and I think the other one is the golden gate bridge in the fog. Friendly service and lots of parking near by. Love the lighting and the wall colors.
author: Mehran A.

description:
Update 6/10/18
I broke down one night feeling too hungry and stopped by to pick up some grub. They told me the food would be ready in 15 min and it was. I started feeling like they are redeeming themselves...The Mu Prik Kang was a little underwhelming in terms of its flavors. The pork ribs that came with the dish were falling of tbe bones albeit salty, just like some reviewers had mentioned. The Mixed Vegetables with tofu was a delight though (added tofu cost extra $2). They used really fresh and healthy ingredients such as Brussels sprouts and broccolis among others. The sauce was light and bursting with fragrance. They used plastic containers for take outs, and that i did not like.  They did not provide napkins or utensils. I actually did not mind the lack of either as I was eating at home.  Just be mindful and ask for them should you need them. Overall I was satisfied with my dinner. But i feel charging their customers $3 for a single portion of white rice was a ripoff.
author: Thuy V.

description:
Awesome Thai restaurant!
Only tried the pad ke mao- great spicyness! And just really well done and the house special curry was also delicious.

Their coconut cake is a must try- if you like young coconut and a light cake. Prolly one of the best coconut cake slices I've had!

Only tip for the restaurant is that their service was a bit slow and pretty novice, but since they're new I'm assuming that can only get better. Also, curry didn't come with rice, had to add that for $3. They should just include it and bump the price up.
author: Alison L.

description:
I've been here I think 4 times and the workers and service are amazing. They work so hard and it shows. And the FOOD!! My friends I've gone with and roommates all day it's great whenever we've gone. 

Friend who just got back from Thailand said "best pad Thai I've had in the city for sure. So comparable to actually being in Thailand"

Their lunch special is gigantic, hard to finish, but I did because I loved it
author: Taylor R.

description:
2nd check in.... after this now I may not be back after all... after finding 2 CATERPILLARS crawling in my salad. I'm good... knowing they don't wash or rinse there salad/lettuce makes me think they don't wash there vegetables... could catch a case of salmonella or E.Coli... 

1st check in I would give them a 5 stars but two stars knocked off for wait time and overpriced for the small portion I got. I called in for 2 items for a to-go/pick order and they said 15-20 minutes. I go and pickup 25 minutes as I've known the previous restaurants at the same location took long as well. I waited another 15 minutes til it was ready. There were only 3 other tables being serviced. When I was ready to eat, I wasn't too happy with the portion I had received, I had ordered the Panang Nuer, as it was 2 (small) pieces of meat and lots of curry sauce with lots of vegetables. Although it was very flavorful I don't know about $15 for the Panang Nuer. If you order the Pad Se Ew (that comes with pork) they will charge you $3 extra to substitute for beef, not everyone eats pork.
author: Keeks P.

description:
Derm is the best Thai restaurant in San Francisco. Great for parties small to large. The owner Tentz works with you to prepare a menu and serves these delicious dishes with perfection. 
The coconut cake is made by his wife Nancy and is the best coconut cake it's moist and not overly sweet. Advance orders can be placed for whole cakes. 
There is a happy hour between 5-6 with discounted beer and appetizers. 
This restaurant is a nice gathering place to eat, sit, and chat. We never feel rushed out and the service is great. A nice place for parties have had several here and all excellent. 
Tentz you deserve 5 stars plus absolutely the best
author: Poi L.

description: Super clean place ( like super clean )  , very nice people and smells so yummy . I accidentally found this place while my daughter and I were on girls night out and so happy we did .!!!!!!
author: Tetyana G.

description: This is definitely one of my favorite Thai restaurants in town. The food was delicious. I ordered Pad Thai and Basil Chicken. Both dishes were delicious! Highly recommend that you try this place.
author: Shinta L.

description:
3.5 Stars, not quite 4 yet. Service was ok (wished the one and only waitress can be a little more upbeat). The wait for food took a bit long, considering there were only 3 tables seated (including us). Wonder how they manage during busy times. The restaurant is clean, spacious, and comfortable.

We ordered the roti with green curry, fried tofu, pad thai, pad see ew, and charbroiled rib eye steak. Noodles were good, appetizers were alright, but the steak was a meh. The flavor was there, nothing spectacular, but not too bad. Not sure why some yelpers claim dishes to have humongous portions, but it was bit skimpy, IMHO. The photo of the pad see ew was like it when it was brought out. 

So this is a borderline if we want to come back or not, but most likely will.
author: Em T.

description:
6/25/17

Decent, about average-priced, somewhat more traditional than typical Thai food.  I appreciate they use some more exotic ingredients that you don't see often like the strange peppercorn-ish bundles in the ribs dish.  But, unfortunately, execution isn't the best...

1. Thai Ice Tea $3:  Didn't get to taste it.

2. Leo, Lager, Thailand $5:  You know, I'd have to say, this was one of the best Asian-style beers I've ever had.  I mean forget the Corona of Japan, Sapporo, or that super shtty Chinese Tsing Tao, the Bud of China... this ain't any of that crap.  There's good body, and good balance.  Some richness.  It's good for what it is.  7/10

3. Roti Kang Kiew $8 "Fried 'roti' with green curry dipping":  Never had roti before--it's kinda like Chinese green onion pancakes, but with more layers and thinner, and lighter.  Dare I say, I think I might even like this more than your typical Chinese version!  That curry dipping sauce kinda sucks though--way too thin to be a sauce.  But I guess maybe that's the way it's supposed to be traditionally?, I don't know.  Anyway, love the roti, but overall not that exciting.  5/10

4. Gai Ping $9 "charcoal grill Thai style marinated chicken's wing w/ dried chili tamarind sauce":  I LOVE the char on this.  Wow... brings a lot of taste to the chicken.  Unfortunately, I think I prefer steroid stuffed, over vaccinated chicken, cause this stuff must have been on some vegan diet.  Meat's a bit stringy, and pretty dry for dark meat.  Flavor's awesome, but the meat quality just ain't there.  5/10 

5. Ka Na Mu Grob $13 "wok-fried CRISPY pork belly and Chinese broccoli":  I was most disappointed with this one.  The description has "CRISPY" all in caps, and well, they didn't use the right word here--I think they're more looking for "HARD SHELLED."  Yes, it's fried... so fried that the outside turned into particle board.  Inside isn't juicy either.  The pork was mixed with some healthy green stuff, which helps balance with the fatness.  4/10

6. Ga Prow Ped $15 "sauteed roast duck in Thai Chili and basil sauce":  Just had a taste of this.  Not bad.  It's kinda like getting roasted duck from a Chinese market, then stir-frying it over.  But tasty.  6/10

7. Mu Prik Kang $15 "fall off bone pork spare ribs stir fried w/ green chili paste, rhizome, peppercorn and basil":  Funny thing is, I actually hate it when meat is literally "fall off the bone" so with that being in the description I was prepared for something I may find less than perfect.  To me, if it's actually delaminating from the bone, well, why have the bone?  I like my American-style ribs very tender and juicy, but still grabbing to the bone's surface--that's the perfect doneness.  Anyway..... again, funny thing is....... though I was prepared, it actually was the opposite!--the meat was definitely stuck on, and maybe even under-braised.  Needs to be tenderized far more.  BUT, like I mentioned above, i LOVED the exotic ingredients in this!  They had these weird peppercorn-tasting branches that was kinda like a cross between capers and peppercorn off a grape bundle.  Also had these crunch small eggplants?--I think they're eggplants.  Anyway, one of the few times I'd say I liked the vegetables more than the meat.  6/10

So...... I loved seeing some new Thai things I don't normally see, but I just wished they cooked everything better.

3/5

#thai
author: Dean C.

description:
I rate my stars primarily on the food for restaurants.  Wait, price, and service come second because I'm looking to promote great food above all else.

That being said, food was bomb.  I've come back multiple times.  More exotic ingredients than usual Thai.  Everything tasted fresh and clean.  Oil tastes as though its sparingly used rather than drenching the food as it seems as most Thai food these days is.  

Quality over quantity.  Meat is cooked tender, ingredients compliment each other.

The only negative thing I'll say is that the restaurant always seems to lightly smell of floor cleaning supplies.  They aren't quick to take your order and the food seemed to take a while but to me that means the food was made fresh rather than kept warm or refrigerated.
author: Natasha B.

description:
Humongous portions, very clean plating and displaying, and delicious, savory, and fragrant ingredients. We ordered the pad thai and pineapple fried rice - the latter was just okay, but the pad thai was awesome. It wasn't dripping in oil but it wasn't dry as a cactus - it was juuuuust fine. Prices were fair, I thought. 

It was a great dinner for two - we especially loved the Thai tea! Would definitely come back.
author: David Y.

description:
Really good food, outstanding flavors...minor tweaks-for the Yum Nuer dish I will ask if they could shred the Petty's next time instead of the whole lettuce leaf...chicken satay was delicious but I did not understand the need for toast on the side.  Green curry was outstanding
We'll be back
author: Michael N.

description: Had a party for my mom's 60th birthday with 25 people, the owner was very accommodating in putting together a preset family style 4-course menu with a selection of appetizers, papaya salad, entrees and coconut cake for dessert. The food and service were exceptional, everything was coursed out and not rushed, even those who don't normally eat Thai food really enjoyed all of the dishes. Would definitely recommend for large groups and will be returning again.
author: Nathan D.

description: This is probably my new favorite San Francisco Thai spot!AND it's only a block away from our apartment! My boyfriend and I went to Thailand about 8 months ago and since then, no Thai restaurant in SF even compares to the flavor and food we ate there. However, today... that all changed! Delicious! Friendly, fast and the staff is definitely hard working! Will most definitely be coming back for more!!
author: Gabrielle Z.

description:
somewhere between the ribs and the duck we decide to watch get out after dinner; next thing we know whitechick x black dude pair walks in. dawg if you're still alive in 24 hours i salute you. or am i going to have to be the one trying to save yoazz lol.
 
either way i should take a break from all this whitewomen stuff bc dem bbbbbz are dangerous. literally. ;p
 
this place doesn't f around w spice - our dishes came hizzot by default till we explicitly asked that further items be less turnt. fyi menu doesn't have icons or asterisks for what's spicy. there's a disclaimer down on the back page that basically says everything's ffffn lit woopwoop!
 
(^_^) Yum Kao Tod (Crushed Fried Riceballs) $11 (http://bit.ly/2rsitLK)
crunchy kinda mealy kinda sour good
 
(^_^) Ga Prow Ped (Sauté Roast Duck) $15 (http://bit.ly/2qqj2S7)
mmm fatty meat wish portion a bit larger
 
(^_^) Prik Khing Gai (Chicken & Green Beans) $12 (http://bit.ly/2qZEVdV)
toughish but chicken n green beans bffs
 
(^_^) Som Tum (Green Papaya Salad) $10 (http://bit.ly/2s1K2J1)
flavor yet not overbearing
 
(-_^) Por Pia Sod (Fresh Rolls) $9 (http://bit.ly/2qZxUK8)
dat sauce on top #twss #norollmo
 
(-_^) Mu Prik Kang (Stir Fried Spare Ribs) $15 (http://bit.ly/2qu5gxc)
mostly tender. spicy unless you ask otherwise
 
(-_^) Kao Pad Tom Yum (Shrimp Fried Rice) $14 (http://bit.ly/2r7of2s)
it's fried rice
 
(-_^) Thai Tea Cake $7 (http://bit.ly/2qZlodu)
dat smooth spongy texture doe
 
good thing we didn't decide on john dubb 2 instead otherwise the resto might've gotten blasted up dayym
 
arroi. kap koon ka!
author: Dan B.

description:
New restaurant, only 3 blocks away from home is a plus. There's only street parking so walking here is great for us.

Service was really good. Super friendly waitress and accommodating kitchen staff. We waited very long for our entree that the rice wasn't hot anymore. She took it back and gave us a fresh bowl. The pad Thai was nice, need more roasted peanuts. The fried pork belly with Chinese broccoli wasn't good, really salty and the pork belly was extremely tough and chewy that it felt like i was chewy rubber. Coconut cake was nice. I would have preferred thinner shavings of coconut though. 

Atmosphere was nice: like the fresh flowers, soft lighting and clean spacious bathroom, dislike the uncomfortable chairs. Would like to see some artwork on the wall. 

I wanted the Thai ice tea but they only have cow's milk, no substitute. 

Not entirely satisfied but happy with service and distance from home so will come back and try other dishes.
author: Alice P.

description: First bite of Charbroiled Chicken with tamarind sauce was soo delicious. I love the coconut cake so light and fluffy. My favorite spot now .
author: Lillian B.

description: I live like a few blocks from Derm so this is a go to place for takeouts and delivery. Their food is pretty good I personally like their Tom Yum soup and sticky mango rice. The staff here is very friendly and i think that the food at this restaurant more of a comfort food. If you don't want to cook at home and want some Thai food that is not too rich and heavy then this is definitely a place for you to try.
author: Deki T.

description:
Their fresh young coconut cake is excellent! My favorite dish on tonight's dinner. I am not much of a dessert person however since it's my first visit here I had to try few things on the menu. Pork belly with Chinese broccoli was very good, a bit salty side however it was savory with brown rice and enjoyed the fresh crunchy Chinese broccoli! 

Penang red curry with beef was flavorful and perfect consistency of creamy coconut milk.  A bit sweet but I can tell you that  it was definitely one of few good Thai curry dishes in S.F  Also Beer and wine choices are excellent!  It's a bit high priced Thai food compared to other restaurants near by.  Happy hour drink price would be a bit better appealing if they focus more on the food sale. 

I'll be back to try few more things soon. We also got a complementary Thai tea cake which my girlfriend loved it!
author: Ichi Y.

description:
Comfort Thai Food done right! As a vegetarian and a lover for strong flavours, Asian food is always my fallback option. 

The staff here is great, they happily customise most dishes into vegetarian. 

Their Pad Kee Maw (Drunken Noodles) is amazing, has the right amount of char to the noodles, it's served hot (temperature) and has the right combination of noodles and vegetables. 

Their Roti with dipping sauce appetiser was good too, although the Roti was too oily the sauce on the side was amazing! The portions are big. The fresh rolls had the right freshness and crunch in its vegetables. Go here, you won't be disappointed!
author: Puneet L.

description:
My wife and I had always wanted to stop in to Derm as it's just around the corner from our place. Finally had lunch last week, and we were there again today!  

Loved the food. Shared the Tom yum soup, the rice paper rolls and a papaya salad the first time. Today we had kee mao with steak and a soup. The food is fresh, fresh, fresh and flavourful. You can ask to adjust the heat level. Both times we've left feeling full and satisfied. We'll be back, especially as we've never had to wait for a table.
author: Uday W.

description: My wife and I really enjoyed Derm. The HOI JOR appetizer was delicious and was dominated by the taste of crab. PAD KE MAO (steak noodle) and PAND PONGKA RI (seafood stew) with jasmine rice were perfect main dishes. Pricing is very reasonable for that quality.
author: Ignacy C.

description: This place is a hidden neighborhood gem. The pad see ew was so good! I also really enjoyed the papaya salad.
author: Irina M.

description: So glad to finally have a good Thai restaurant in the neighbourhood. Cozy atmosphere & authentic flavour never disappoints. Service is always really friendly as well! Happy hour deal for Thai beers is cheaper than beers in Thailand, which is also a pleasant surprise considering the locale.
author: Kartik M.

description:
Just ate dinner here and I'm super excited to finally have a REALLY good thai restaurant in our hood. Well, technically Derm is a little bit outside our hood (we're about 3/4 mile away) but we're totally walking the distance  to make this a regular haunt. Consumed were the following: 

Guay tiew lui suan- super fresh, and the dipping sauce a great ginger-y spicy accompaniment. Just the right amount of chew in the rice wrapper, and the veggies were fresh. 

Tom ka gai soup- this is our standard appetizer when we eat thai food, happy to report Derm's is super delicious. Perfect creamy coconut base with just a hint of tanginess, lots of chicken. 

Pad see ew- the other yelpers told me this was not to be missed. I'm really glad I ordered it. Too many times at other restaurants, it tastes like the noodles barely spent time getting seared in the pan. Derm's noodles had a delicious char on them with a perfect chew. Good amount of meat and crisp broccoli in there, too. 

Ga prow gai- really well seasoned. Great over the sticky rice. Meaty!

Servers were attentive and very nice.  Definitely coming back here soon. I didn't have room for dessert but want to try their sweet roti so bad!
author: Summer E.

description:
We live around the corner of this place, but that's not the reason we are writing this review. We are writing because Derm is one of the two "best" Thai places in SF (other one being Lers Ros). The food is high-quality and incredibly flavorful. There are other cheaper options ahemKingOfahem but the user experience is night and day, Apple and Blackberry.  

Ever since we found this place, we frequent Derm on a weekly basis.

Thanks for bringing some real Thai food into the neighborhood- Anthony Bourdain would've been proud.
author: Michael L.

description: Service was pretty slow but I give them a pass with how packed it was. The food made up for all the waiting. You need to try a creamsicle stuff bun. It is the most delicious thing I ever ate.
author: Sean D.

description: Best Thai food in SF.  Eat here often, everything is delicious.  Cute little space with friendly staff.
author: Olga P.

description: This has quickly become one of our go-to weeknight restaurants. The food is really, really good. Surprisingly good, actually, for such an unassuming little place. They also have a nice beverage list, good music, and friendly service. It's a great little neighborhood place and is requested by my five year old quite often. It seems family run and I wish them all the best.
author: Anna D.

description: Fantastic! It is traditional Thai, but seemed to have  its own distinct flavors and little upgrades. The Kati appetizer (dipped in green curry) and the Pad See Ew (with pork) were exceptional. I will be talking about this place for the next few days and can hardly wait to return!
author: Justin J.

description: Came here for dinner and was not disappointed! The flavors were on point and they had the classics as well as dishes I'd never heard of before. We got the Papaya salad, Pad kee mao and mu prik kang. Everything was spiced perfectly and tasted way more gourmet than the other Thai places I have tried (in sf and other cities).
author: J P.

description: We got delivery. We were very surprised at the very small serving of sticky rice for $3. It was only a few bites. The $8 soup was barely enough to share. Very small. The Pad Kee Mao was a pretty good size but very spicy and not incredibly flavorful for balance. The green curry was excellent. The spring rolls were also rather small in portion for the price. Delivery was fast and friendly. So overall, fairly good, green curry shined, but too expensive for what we got.
author: Aaron W.

description: It was absolutely delicious!! Definitely worth 5 stars. The lunch special combo is a GREAT deal! The thai iced tea was the best I've EVER had!! The pad thai was delicious!
author: Isabella B.

description:
I REALLY hope this place makes it. In a city where people have mostly sworn their allegiance to a Thai restaurant for pick-up, delivery, sit-in, Derm's slightly sophisticated offering of Thai dishes deserves more than a shot: It deserves full-on discovery into the menu.

I went for lunch with my mom so we needed to keep things easy (no cuttlefish). We started off with chicken satay and small "fried wonton bags" stuffed with (pork or chicken?) and shrimp. Bother were cooked perfectly: the satay was grilled with a tasty layer of yellow curry on it. The wontons were golden brown.

after these two delicious dishes, we split the panang curry with slow-cooked beef chuck and peppers. Another score! Panang is one of my favorite curries and Derm does it well. And in a way I had never had it.

TIP: Look at the menu online before you go! Not because their menu is so expansive but because it is so interesting and delicious-sounding, you'll need the time.
author: Ben R.

description: The food is delicious, the service is great, and they have a reasonably priced lunch special. The pad Thai here is pretty good as were their other dishes.
author: Rami R.

description:
Food was great.  Pad Thai and Choo Chee Goong is what we experienced.  Fresh and delicious.  Service fast and friendly.  Couple of cold Singha's tasted great with the meal.
I will definitely go back to Derm.  Sunday evening was quiet.
author: Stuart S.

description:
Derm was a solid spot for a group luncheon. I made a reservation the day before and came by the next day with a group of fourteen. Our table was already prepped upon arrival -- I was impressed by the clean and modern decor, including the fresh seasonal flowers at each table.

The menu had a lot of options that suited our diverse group -- we had some folks that didn't eat red meat, some that didn't eat fish (including anything with fish sauce), and some that didn't eat too-spicy food. Everyone was satisfied with the availability of choices.

The group shared the por pia sod (Thai fresh rolls), por pia tod (crispy egg rolls) and the roti jang kiew (crispy fried flatbread) to share. We enjoyed everything but I would definitely order the por pia sod again -- the sauce on top was great. 

For my entree, I ordered the Pad Ke Mao which was quite good but a LOT of food for one person. I ended up eating half of it and taking the rest to go for lunch the next day. Not a super smart move given that the rice noodles got clumpy and had an undesirable texture when re-heated. I would recommend splitting one order for two people and just eating it all on-site.

Service was a bit slow but that was likely because there was only one server for the whole restaurant. Additionally, our meals didn't exactly come near-in-time to one another. I estimate that there was a gap of about twenty minutes between when the first entree came out and the last entree arrived. This made for a bit of awkward timing as some were nearly done with their food by the time others just started eating.

I'll be back to try them for dinner. Overall, a great option for some solid Thai in the neighborhood.
author: Bianca P.

description:
Oh my goodness! This place sure didn't disappoint! 

We ordered pick up from Eat24 and loved every dish! The chicken wings and papaya salad were delicious but the best item was surely the fresh young coconut cake! So fluffy and just the right amount of sweetness. 

Didn't order much this time but already looking to go back! Everything was super flavorful and fresh!
author: Shanna N.

description:
Great food at great prices! Ordered Tum yum soup, Grilled pork and pad see you. All cooked perfectly and delicious!

Minus one star for service which was bordering  on non-attentive when we were one of two customers. Not good.
author: T K.

description: Favorite Thai restaurant in SF! Every dish we have had is wonderful. The Roti with Green Curry is the best we have had anywhere. In addition to excellent food they have great beer, nice chill modern decor and friendly staff.
author: Rock H.

description:
After two generations of lackluster establishments in this location we finally have a wonderful, easy place for solid food. 

We have now been three times (take out only) and everything has been wonderful. The Larb is wonderful and pounded fresh. The tom kha gai is also been consistently great. 

In short visit this local gem so it stays open and we can enjoy good Thai around the corner. Please. Srly. You'll like it.
author: Donald C.

description: We had lunch with my friend. A bit pricey for what one would tend to pay for lunch in this area of the city (no specific lunch menu same price as dinner) HOWEVER it was tasty, original and well presented. Worth the few extra dollars. The place is also clean and the owner (we guess the lady was the owner) obviously cared about the food she was serving and her customers. It only recently opened and we wish them great success. We would go back. Great spot. We shared a Steamed pork salad, the slightly fried chicken and the first roll on the menu (sausage in it). See pics.
author: Val M.

description: This place is my new favorite Thai restaurant. Try the fried pork with chinese broccoli , pad Thai , Ground chicken basil you won't regret it.  Very authentic. Service is so nice and genuine. This is a family owned restaurant. Go support. They have a cute little girl that hang out and helps mom.
author: Sam S.

description: This restaurant is so great and delicious! Great place for amazing Thai food! It's probably one of the cleanest restaurants I've seen. Great service and very kind and nice people!! I'm definitely going to come back soon!!!
author: Mia G.

description:
Defiantly digging this place.
Fat portions, they got leo beer and everyone is friendly.
author: Calvin S.

description:
If you have read any of my other reviews, you'll notice that I tend to only highlight those businesses that are extremely good or extremely poor.  Derm is the former.

I'm not a huge fan of curry, so many of the dishes I will never try.  However, those that I have tried were no less than fantastic.  Spicy dishes are just spicy enough without being over-bearing.  All of the ingredients (especially the fresh ones, like in their rolls) taste like they were picked less than an hour ago.  Seriously.

The owners are terrific and very very friendly.  Show this new business some love and stop in for some food at one of the best Thai restaurants in town!  You will be so happy you did, you'll come back again and again.

Oh, and the dessert cakes are amazing!  Especially the ice tea cake.

Welcome to the 'hood.
author: Lloyd H.

description:
Just opened last week and I've eaten here three times already!
The owners are super nice and the service is quick.
By far the best Pad Thai I have ever had.
The portions are VERY generous with all of the dishes they serve.
Had the Larb today and it was delicious!
author: Keith W.

description: Derm has a delicious Thai food and nice staff. Definitely recommend it, it's a fairly small and cozy place, easy to miss if you're walking by, but be sure to get in and try the food, it's reeeeally good!
author: Felipe L.

description: Horrible food. Ordered beef panang curry. The meat was like a firm rubber, it smelled bad and didn't taste fresh. When I complained they took the food and sort of recooked it and brought it back. I tried it again and it was really bad. I decided to just pay and leave without even eating it. The waiter rushed to charge me nevertheless. I wonder if the owner cares what's going in with customer service and quality of the food in his restaurant. I'm definitely complaining to consumer protection agency.
author: Jakhongir Y.

description: What am I missing? SF Yelp ratings are generally reliable, so how does Derm have 4.5 stars when my experience there is maaaaybe 1.5 stars? Gah. The service is fine, a bit slow but not too much so, and it's friendly. But the food is just meh and uninspired--and definitely priced like it's pretty good, y'know? I've been there now three times, including once with a couple of fellow foodies, and... no. Sorry, Derm. I wanted to love you.
author: Neha B.

description: I really like their Hoi Jor (crab cake)!  It's delicately fried and not greasy.  The prices are higher than the average Thai restaurant, but I think the quality and the authenticity is above average, so it's well worth the slight premium.  I've also eaten at the restaurant a few times (besides takeout), and I think the decor is tranquil and comfy, not like the previous ownership (they had sports TV blasting).  I think the boss is also the chef.  He seems to really take pride in his culinary skills.  Keep up the good work!
author: Warren L.

description: Really solid Thai food. Very nice people running the place.  One of my favorite local spots!
author: Matthew S.

description: Great neighborhood Thai restaurant. Super friendly staff and the food is solid and well priced.
author: Jan S.

description: Good food! Kind of strange dining room, but we did enjoy everything we had there. We let the waitress explain how to eat one of the salads and that was nice to have an authentic suggestion.
author: Brianna S.

description:
Really enjoyed the chicken wings appetizer - very nicely grilled!
And the crab fried rice was also nice - not oily unlike the other restaurants which is great. Very nice service.
author: Renee C.

description: Visited Derm for the first time while looking for a place to sit down and have a nice meal without breaking the bank. We weren't sure what to expect since the name is somewhat unusual (found out it's aThai word...of course, lol) but decided to trust the solid online reviews. Our table of four ended up being all around pleased with the quality of the food and the pleasant service. Although I've never been to Thailand, I consider myself a bit familiar with Thai food (having been schooled in a few points about the cuisine by friends). I appreciated that Derm had a nice menu offering that goes beyond the typical pad thai dishes, while still being friendly to those that don't want to delve too far from the norm. We really enjoyed the Ka Na Mu Grob (pork belly and Chinese broccoli dish), pad see-ew, and house special panang curry.  All of the dishes were tasty and definitely a step above the typical Thai I've encountered at other restaurants of this style and price point. The woman helping us was very attentive and helpful throughout the meal, even checking on us to see how we liked a specific dish since she said some customers may find it too spicy. The spice factor tended to follow the "American" scale in that it wasn't too spicy. If you can handle more spice, definitely let them know and I'm sure they can accommodate you. Overall we were really happy with out choice and meal at Derm.
author: Jordann A.

description: Came here for dinner and it was fantastic! The dishes were flavorful and the service was great. Had a nice, modern ambiance and the prices were fair. Will definitely be coming back!!!
author: Janice Z.

description: Wow! I was pleasantly surprised by this restaurant. I ordered this food on DoorDash and it came neatly packaged and HOT. I ordered the Tom Yum soup and pad Thai and both were a 5/5 for me. The tom yum was very flavorful and soothing to eat (especially since I'm sick atm). The pad Thai was a good portion size and was delicious and fresh. Even though this was delivered, it tasted and felt like I was eating at a restaurant. Will definitely order again, or maybe even come in one day
author: Dana S.

description:
The food is very good. The service is nice and welcoming. We wanted to change the dishes - no cilantro, chicken instead of shrimps, and so on, and there was no problem. The stuff were very accommodating.  
The only complain that we have on the place is that there is no free Wi.Fi.
author: Gila C.

description: A very nice neighborhood Thai restaurant. We had the grilled tiger prawn with reduced red curry sauce, pad see ew, and sauteed Brussel sprouts. They were all well prepared and delicious, especially the prawns. We were served huge prawns with French beans on a rich red curry reduction sauce. A relative bargain at $16.
author: Indigo B.

description: This is a new restaurant, opened about a month ago. We've taken friends and family there 4 times already, for both lunch and dinner. The food and services were both exceptional. Our favorites were the tiger prawns, yellow curry with chicken, egg plant with beef, pad thai, papaya salad. The owner's wife makes a Thai tea cake was also good.
author: Gene L.

description: We had a wonderful dinner at Derm. Overall, the food and the service were great. We enjoyed the chicken satay, a noodle dish, a rather spicy but wonderful red curry, and a brussel sprouts dish that I have not seen offered elsewhere. The food came quickly and the server checked in with us frequently. It's love to return to Derm again.
author: Rich S.

description: We went there totally spontaneously and were very satisfied with the food and friendly service. The grilled prawn with reduced red curry was out of the world! We wished we wouldn't have been so full, so we could have tasted their dessert ;-)
author: Divya R.

description: Just tried this new Thai restaurant and I have to say...wow! We had the Kang Phed Ped Yang (roast duck with red curry sauce), the Kang Daeng Pak (red curry with tofu), and the mango sticky rice. The vegetables were fresh and bursting with flavor. The duck was outstanding. The mango sticky rice is my wife's favorite dessert and was the perfect ending to  a delicious meal. The restaurant itself is clean and has a great ambiance. This will be our new go-to Thai spot in the neighborhood.
author: Larry K.

description: Food is great, super accommodating for vegans and vegetarians. Service is excellent; servers are knowledgeable and easy going. Difficult to find parking so good luck...
author: Adeline H.

description: Great food, the coconut chicken mushroom soup was delicious with a complex flavour. It brought us back to life after being out in the cold. We also had the house special Panang curry with beef - the curry was very flavourful, and the beef had a few chewy pieces but the rest was tender. The roti was super crispy, but on the small side.
author: Raymond J.

description: Great food (the roasted duck was awesome), good service, and excellent value.  The ice tea was the best I've ever had.
author: Duane D.

description: Finally, amazing Thai!! This is by far the best Thai I've had in not only San Francisco, but also California!! We had the Thai iced tea, Pad Thai, and Pad Ke Mao. All of it was perfection. This will definitely be our new "go to."
author: Whitney T.

description:
Really solid restaurant. Love the food, love the flavors, love the options --

Only reason it got one less star is because the acoustics of the room make it hard to hear your friends.

Definitely do not recommend this as a date place on a busy dinner night, otherwise very solid place. 

I got the pad thai and they use the smaller thin rice noodles -- lots of rich flavors and good amount of egg used. It's on the average to slightly above average thai places considering Tenderloin isn't too far. Though for the cleanliness and reduced chances of getting decked in the face, I'll pay the premium.

Overall, would recommend. Pad kee mao looked very good. Soft noodles and hand stripped!
author: Vi T.

description: Fantasic meal!  The dishs have deep and nuanced flavor, good- sized portions for sharing, everything tasted very fresh.  We had the spring rolls, pad thai, duck in red curry, shortribs, and a green curry.  Outstanding!
author: Susan S.

description: An excellent addition to the neighborhood!  Derm replaces multiple iterations of other failed Chinese/Asian Fusion restaurants in the same space.  I spent a year in Thailand so I'm partial to my ability to review an authentic Thai experience.  :)  The stand out at Derm is the quality of the ingredients and preparation.  Also, excellent sized portions.  We had the braised chicken yellow curry (a unique take and we liked it), pad see ew (ordered with light soy sauce and that was perfect), and brussel sprouts (could have been cooked a tiny bit longer / crispier).  washed all that down with two cha manau teas (thai iced tea with lemon.lime, but without the milk) that are not on menu but they were nice enough to make for us when we asked.  food takes a little longer and it was well worth the wait.  atmosphere is fine, but nothing too fancy.
author: Matthew L.

description: Excellent flavors, really enjoyed a wonderful seafood dish, spicy without being too hot, sweet without being over whelming, tremendously well balanced. Great value.
author: Scott P.

description: When I travel I'm always looking to try new vegan friendly Thai restaurants and this new spot really impressed, the service was quick, friendly and the food was excellent and not too expensive. The tofu they use here is amazing! Try the Tofu Tod, Tom Kha Tofu and corn potato appetizer.
author: Oz Y.

description: Great food! But service need to be improved.. On a busy saturday lunch time, theres only one girl serve the food... Every table waited a long time for their food to come. Finished my water but got no one to fill it up again..They need to hire more waitresses or waiters. If you come during a not busy day, you wont disappointed because the food is really good!
author: Melissa K.

description: Derm is my Go To Thai Restaurant! Owned by a young and humble family, they have friendly, quick, and excellent customer service. The food is flavorful, delicious, and delightfully comforting. I recommend the Pad Ke Mao, Kao Pad Sapperos, Pad Thai, and Num Prik Pao Nuer. Be sure to specify your level of heat. They like their spices with a kick! Overall, Derm has a great selection of rich Thai dishes in a warm and inviting atmosphere. I highly recommend this place.
author: Doris D.

description: This Thai restaurant is the real thing. A lovely couple own and run it with care. This is the best Thai food in SF now. I love that they think carefully about their flavors and don't just list curries or dishes with choice of 5 meats/fish/tofu, but only use the one which is the culinary match to the sauce. I've been twice now, and can't wait to keep going back to try more. For dessert, the owner makes a coconut cake and the sweet crunchy dessert roti's are addictive. They also carry 4 -5 unique beers on tap, including local breweries. The atmosphere is not great, but it is clean and easy to have conversations!
author: Bea L.

description: Great addition to the neighborhood.  Very good service and quality food. The Pad Thai was excellent and the red curry Kang Daeng Pak was over the top. We started with the shrimp rice wrap and added wok tossed Brussel Sprouts with garlic.  Great location and easy area parking if needed.  Strong recommendation for dinner or take out.
author: GREG C.

description: Really enjoyed the food at this Thai restaurant.  I only did take-out with pad Thai, green curry and sticky rice.  The spices and flavorings meld together really well.  The place isn't fancy but the food was outstanding. I will definitely come back and eat in next time. A winner in my book and I'm very particular.
author: Irene S.

description: Great tasty food, had the egg rolls, yellow chicken Curry and the pad Tai and everything was really good!
author: Irit M.

description: My girlfriend and I were very pleased with our dinner here.  She had the roast pork belly with Chinese broccoli and I had the sauteed duck, both were great.  They gave us a complimentary slice of Thai iced tea cake which was delicious -- moist, good flavor and not too sweet.  Service was excellent.  We'll definitely be back.
author: David C.

description: Delicious food and very good service.  The stand outs were the salad with the rice balls, grilled squid, crab fried rice and pad see yew. The chef that made the fried rice has some skills.  The dish was perfectly made.  Derm will be our new go to restaurant for Thai food.
author: c v.

description: My family of five ate at Derm for our son's 24th birthday.  My boys say we always eat Italian so searched on Yelp for a Thai restaurant near their place and Derm popped up. A new restaurant with very good reviews so a reservation was made.  We started with chicken satay and fresh shrimp rolls.  Both were very tasty and gone quickly.  We also had the ribs, brussel sprouts, tofu and eggplant dish, pad thai and a thicker noodle chicken dish with two bowls of brown rice.  This was sufficient for five of us and there were no leftovers.  All of our dishes were flavorful and plentiful.  The service was very quick.  The price of dinner.....$126 for a party of five with one beer and one glass of wine.  Would definitely return.
author: Kathy T.

description: I ate here a couple of months ago and look forward to returning. I can get a bit noisy so when I return, it will be for lunch or early dinner. I had the pad Thai and really enjoyed it. Would definitely order it again.  My dining companion had one of the curries (I can't remember which one) which was tasty but a little spicy for me. She loved it.
author: Jamie K.

description: Food was almost OK, the service was mediocre at best. I was lured to this place by very good reviews on Yelp, but the reality turned to be not so bright - the waitress barely paid attention to our party and brought the ordered tea when we finished cake. In a few hours, half of the guests informed of some weird food allergies they had due to the strange ingredients used by the cooks. Will never come to this place again...
author: Alexander L.

description: This neighborhood Thai restaurant was a delightful surprise when we ate dinner there last night.  Service was very attentive, even as the tables began to fill.  Food choices are interesting, and we really enjoyed an amazing sweet corn appetizer, the special short ribs preparations (in a lovely curry sauce, and the meat was tender and not at all fatty) and a tofu curry dish.  There are nice beer selections, too.  I'm excited because the food is well prepared, the menu choices are varied and the prices are reasonable.  Glad to have this choice in the neighborhood.
author: Bonnie L.
